0w5TaTnvvx5-1MHGDX5omA.text: Great Asian fusion! We stopped here for a late night dinner. It looked empty and there was only one table and one couple at the bar, but they have late hours and seated us. They have a pretty comprehensive menu that can satisfy any craving for Asian. We ordered spicy edamame and ginger rice to share and each ordered sushi rolls.  The edamame was yummy! Spicy enough, but not unbearable. The ginger rice was delicious. It was sweet and flavorful and balanced.  For my sushi roll I ordered the sweet tofu and veggie roll. It was fresh and delicious. The tofu was cooked well and not greasy.

photos.caption: Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Green Forest Roll
Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Edamame and Ginger Fried Rice

X5P18FqxYFACT_i-5lMS5w.text: I've been here twice and while I've really wanted to like this place, I'd found myself disappointed both times. Most recently, I had their Crispy Rock Shrimp. I think I was expecting to get a spicy, Bang Bang shrimp dish. It came out with two types of shrimp. One side had a little bit of spice while the other had an orange color and even the waitress said it smelled like Doritos. The dish itself was average at best.  We also got lettuce wraps which turned out to be good kind chicken presented with green leaf lettuce. While I'm a big fan of green leaf salad, this is one of the few times that I want a nice big piece of iceberg lettuce. The chicken wraps were also average at best. For entrees, We got the Social House chicken and the Waygu. The steak was decent, but I could have gotten an equally good steak for half the price at a Longhorn steakhouse. The chicken was something that also was ok, but even my wife who likes bland food thought it was a bit bland. As far as the savory foods, the best portion was the ginger fried rice. Again, nothing great, but good enough.  The best part of the meal was the dessert which was the Fortune Cookie. It's an enormous fortune cookie with a half chocolate/half vanilla mousse that my wife and I both enjoyed.  The only reason I gave 3 stars is that we both liked the atmosphere and had a very good server. The food itself is about a 2.5.

amTUX_FUPnkNS5RKTzbBng.text: We came here after a friend recommended this place. I had looked into it quite a bit, because I tend to be picky about sushi restaurants, but after looking over the menu, we decided to try it.  We got there at about 5pm, and the place was mostly empty. It did fill up a bit before we left (~630), but it may have been a slow night. That worked to our favor,  because it meant more attentive service.  We asked about happy hour specials, and we informed once we were at the table, that was only at the bar. That sucked, because I had been planning on ordering off the happy hour sushi menu since it was significantly cheaper, but we bit the bullet and stayed at the table. The one thing that did upset me was the server told me that he would get my drink on the happy hour price, and then didn't. I have no way of knowing if that drink was even part of the happy hour special, but to be charged full price after being misled that it would be discounted in any form was annoying.   I ordered the Kung Fu Punch. It kind of reminded me of a sangria-esq drink. I did like it, but not sure if I would order it again (very sweet!).  Our server explained the menu in a lot of detail (maybe more than we needed?), and gave recommendations. I did like that he told us what not to buy, because honestly sometimes it's nice to know from a customer perspective that xyz isn't very good here.   We decided on three rolls: spicy tuna, alaskan crab california, and godzilla. They were fantastic. Nothing super special in the rolls, but they did not disappoint in quality and taste. We left feeling very full. I definitely recommend splitting rolls and not doing more than 3 or 4 of them, because you certainly fill up quick!  We didn't drink any more than that one drink because we did not get the happy hour menu (and the cocktails were fairly $$$) so unfortunately I cannot attest to any other drinks, maybe next time though?  Overall, the aesthetic and food was really good, but I was not impressed at the cost of everything, for what we got. It's pricey, so keep that in mind if you pay full price! We'll probably come back in the future, but it's not at the top of our list.

photos.caption: Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2u_rc19Q7R4uuqGBbM_A7Q.text: Beautiful trendy restaurant that serves a variety of Asian-inspired foods. We went with another couple for Restaurant Week. My only complaint was that we did not feel the waiter had sufficiently warned us how much food was in the 3-course prix-fixe menu, so we stuffed ourselves with 2 orders and still took home leftovers. The mussels, steak, and salmon were excellent; the tuna was okay. The grilled asparagus was wilted, but the other sides were good (rice, salad). Good selection of cocktails, and great people watching. Server otherwise fit the bill. I would come back to try other items on the menu for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Really delicious Restaurant Week dessert
Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Restaurant Week mussels
Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mood lighting

DIh7VupE5JBdbY4noPz1aw.text: Recently a friend had his birthday celebration here with dinner and drinks. What a wonderful evening it was. The atmosphere is relaxing and welcoming with a friendly staff. The cocktails are good and the food is even better. Definitely one of the nicer restaurants downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

rpZqd94AXuCBx6A8vLMRKA.text: Hands down one of the best happy hours in Pittsburgh!! I love that it's later than most other happy hours--5-7pm, Monday thru Friday. They have $4 sake bombs and sake carafes, $5 cocktails and appetizers, and half off select sushi rolls. It makes for a great, cheap dinner. The chee chee brussels sprouts are a MUST. Even if you dont like brussels sprouts. Get them. You're welcome. I also love their giant fortune cookie dessert. It's fun to come here in a group as the food is the perfect size for sharing. The service is always friendly, but can be slow sometimes.  Social House Seven has never really disappointed me, but I think they do suffer from trying to be too many things at once. Their menu is pretty big, but that means that some items don't get as much attention as others, and the quality can vary. I recommend if you're unsure to ask your waiter for suggestions, they're always pretty honest about what to skip. The prices can be inconsistent as well. Some of the robata items are very small portions but come with a big price tag, and then there's items like the chee chee brussels sprouts that you get SO MUCH of for the price.   Overall, I'm going to keep going to Social House Seven for happy hour because it's such a great deal. And even though they have some good menu items, it wouldn't be my first choice for lunch or dinner because of the prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chee Chee Fried Brussels Sprouts
Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll, Green Forest Roll

Sr2U06b-xAi7xUh9CdsEeA.text: The only time I've been here was during happy hour. They have pretty good happy hour specials available Monday to Friday with half price sushi and $5 appetizers.   We tried the spicy tuna sushi roll, the crunchy spicy tuna roll and the Alaskan roll in addition to the pork dumplings and brussel sprouts. Everything was good but nothing to write home about.   Service here isn't the most attentive. I had to ask several times to get water refilled and to place orders. Food did clean out fairly quickly.   Overall I think it's a good deal for happy although definitely not the best sushi I've had. Will probably come back for their happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy hour menu
Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dumplings
Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brussel sprouts

hnkt1_IgxdCMJbnfGMKa1g.text: I don't think I had ever heard of this place before but we came here on a recommendation from a friend before going to a show downtown. We had a great meal and would definitely be back.  The restaurant ambience kind of embraces the Asian fusion vibe, and it looks like they seem to have decor from various Eastern cultures. That could be intentional or I could be overthinking it. There's a neat atmosphere though and our service was fine.  Their happy hour specials are awesome but take note that most of them only seem to apply to bar seating. We had a table but were still able to get a half priced bottle of wine.  The menu is pretty diverse. We tried the fried brussel sprouts, fried dumplings, and a few sushi rolls. The Poke Aloha is one of the more popular ones per our server and it was fantastic. It's a tuna tartare roll with some great flavors.  If you're part of the downtown happy hour crowd, you definitely want to add this to your list of venues. Great food and great drink variety.

uWxtMLB261GvbhlCh67TDQ.text: For being an Asian themed restaurant, I think the food could've been executed better. I only got a sushi roll though so I would definitely try this place out again.   I sat at the bar and ordered two Moscow mules. They were very tasty! The atmosphere is great inside, the decor is fabulous!

photos.caption: Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QOQaYzam2cLVda7jV-waLQ.text: We managed to get here and enjoy some happy hour drinks while waiting for our friend to join us for dinner. Because we like to enjoy local beers, we ordered Youngling lager (Pottstown, PA) and Fat Head's Head Hunter IPA (North Olmsted, OH - not quite local, but closer than MSP!). We chose this spot due to proximity to the convention center, so it was a great surprise to see so many yummy items on the menu. We sat at the bar where Jen took excellent care of us.  Because it was a bit cold and damp, I started with house miso soup. It was very flavorful and warmed me to my bones. Smokin' Hubster ordered the scallop pad thai and didn't offer me a taste or anything! I had the Chicken with hidden dragon (I don't think there were dragons in there; hidden very well!) which was filling and tasty.  The menu is impressive and we'd work our way through it if we lived nearby.

Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Very awesome house miso

w36xl0nWZUFugKUDdnehAg.text: Since I work downtown, it's easy to go to different places for lunch. This is the first time I've ever eaten here, surprisingly, because I love this type of cuisine. But my coworker and I went for lunch. It was by no means busy. The decor was very modern and I would imagine it to be a great place to go at night and with friends, just based on looks alone. It was dimly lit and we were sat at one of the booths that was on a riser. I can definitely see the appeal for night time drinks or if you wanted to spend a lot of money for dinner.   I was not impressed by the food or prices, however. Service was okay. It was lunch and not busy and didn't take too long for our food. But the taste wasn't incredible or anything. It LOOKED very appealing, I got ramen and it was very Americanized. They literally use ramen noodles that you would get from the orange pack. Throw in an egg with miso broth and spinach. They do put beef in there and a hearty amount of pork belly so there's no need to add on protein. It was okay. I've had better. The egg roll was not really good and it was literally sitting on a bed of broccoli slaw you get from Trader Joe's or Giant Eagle, which made me laugh. It was crispy and the inside had a kick but the meat was indiscernible, which made it not good. The sushi was fine, though. Just honestly your basic rolls and nothing too special or fresh about them and totally over priced. $9 for a basic salmon roll??!!  I wouldn't come here again. You can get more authentic cuisine like this elsewhere and for a better price. I think it's just hyped up because of the location and the decor. But I mean, try it if you'd like, it's not awful or anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ramen and egg rolls

rAGPO5EAYvKXiOCeS2a2Aw.text: I have been to this restaurant for drinks after several events, but never there to have their food.  So, when my normal lunch buddies suggested that we have lunch here during a recent date, I was down.  Now let me describe the interior of Social House 7.  Picture a giant lounging Buddha leisurely resting over the tops of several booths.  Also picture what looks like hand-planed wooden floors and Japanese inspired metal fish scale and shoji screens placed throughout the restaurant.  There are also hand-painted Geishas and floral artwork embellishing several walls in the interior.  If you're really into restaurant interiors, this restaurant's interior is the place for you.  And please don't forget to look down upon entry so that you don't miss the large koi swimming around underfoot in the floor.  Really spectacular!  It's a riff on the interior of Philadelphia's Buddakan restaurant in more ways than one.  Someone was really thoughtful about the look of this restaurant.  With regards to the food, my hungry lunch mates and I damn near ordered the entire lunch menu.  We had the Chee Chee Fried Brussels Sprouts with almonds, chili sauce and bonito flakes for $7, the Sauteed Spicy Edamame with jalapeno, garlic, sesame oil and soy for $8, the Ginger Fried Rice with ginger, scallions, garlic, onion, soy, white rice and Crispy rock shrimp(Add $5)  for $8, 2 Korean Cheesesteak sandwiches served with Bulgogi style rib eye, sweet peppers, grilled onions, cheese, and Korean BBQ sauce for $13 and last but not least, the Bahn Mi served with marinated pork tenderloin, Crouching Tiger sauce, cucumbers and cilantro for $8.  I just became exhausted listing all of that food.  I never liked Brussels sprouts as a child because my mother murdered most vegetables, with Brussels sprouts being no exception.  Social House 7's Brussels sprouts will make you change whatever pre-conceived notion that you may have about the vegetable.  Crunchy, salty, earthy and spicy...Yummy!  The Sauteed Spicy Edamame were also pretty tasty. (Just a little messy to eat.)  The Bahn Mi snuck up on me with jalapeno slices tucked into the sandwich at various intervals and ordered with Ginger Fried Rice and crispy rock shrimp, I was in Asian food heaven.  My lunch buddies were also in heaven with their Korean Cheesesteak sandwiches.  None of us could finish any of our meals and we usually act like Hoover vacuum cleaners and suck up everything in sight.  I honestly have to say that everything was really tasty.  So I was surprised that the restaurant wasn't packed because of the tastiness of the food, the reasonable prices, the wait staff service and the decor.  However, the one drawback to this restaurant is the wait times.  Oh Lord!  We received the Brussels sprouts quickly and I received my Bahn Mi sandwich quickly, but then we waited almost a century for the rest of the food.  Too bad or else I would give this place top of the morning marks.  That being said, I would still recommend this restaurant.  Just don't go there and be in a hurry.

5UYR859oP6kPiqOB4fCx0A.text: My son and I stopped here for lunch before going to see our first series show at the Benedum. We were able to get seated right away and they still had the front windows open even though temperatures have now fallen.  Remembering they had a vegan menu I asked to see it. The vegan menu offers a good selection of modifications off the regular lunch and dinner menu, however, in order to find prices you have to ask for the lunch and dinner menus since they left that off. I was hoping to get the Brussel Sprouts appetizer but learned due to popularity, they were out of them. Instead I ordered the Ki king broccoli as my appetizer. My son chose the vegan green forest roll sushi for his appetizer.  They serve you with either chopsticks or regular utensils. I really wasn't expecting much in the way of appetizers but the portions of both the broccoli and the sushi were more than enough for the two of us to share. They both were very good and if I hadn't ordered a salad to go with the Ki king broccoli that could have been a meal in itself. The  sushi was also very good but a bit on the spicy side for me.  For my main salad again I wanted the crispy brussel but they were out of that as well. So I chose the sesame broccoli salad. This salad comes with sesame croquette, carrot, broccoli and more on a bed of napa cabbage. My son went with the vegan version of Bi Bim Bap with tofu on top. This dish is served with rice and I didn't want to be overfilled with eating rice.  We got our food fairly quickly. I loved my broccoli salad which although not listed on the vegan menu is a vegan salad on their website. It was very filling and quite good. My son enjoyed his Bi Bim Bap and let me sample it. The dish has a bit of a kick to it if you love spice but he loved it.   The vegan menu is something you must ask for.  In addition to that they have vegetarian and gluten free items clearly marked on the menu. We were able to use my 15% discount coupon that came with my subscriber series to save a little on the check.  This place does have a full bar but we didn't use it.  Hopefully next time I return I can try their Brussel Sprouts which they have a vegan version of.  Located on the 7th Ave downtown the restaurant is opposite the theater square garage and a block away from the Benedum Center.

photos.caption: Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan Bi Bim Bap with tofu
Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sesame Broccoli salad with croquettes, carrots, pickled lotus and napa cabbage

Xdw4MSir6s_w_9x_gAWbbg.text: I was so excited when this restaurant was opening, especially since I work downtown. I've tried it twice and have been disappointed twice. It's a shame. I hate to write a negative review, but after two trips a year apart, it's not getting better.   The service is always awful. You have to beg the wait staff for everything. It's ridiculous. The food is not much better. Not sure why people rave about this place. It's a giant disappointment. If you have bad food or service that's one thing but you better not have both.   The food my husband and I got was tasteless and not worth what we paid or how long we waited for it. If you spend more money on something, it better be good. This wasn't. Such a shame. We all we're going to see Hamilton, told the server that and it still too forever. They also brought out entrees one at a time which is ridiculous. Mine came last and everyone was done eating by the time mine came so they had to wait for me.   Will not be back. They need to pull it together.

XqKIZf7696zgII-c6OU-QQ.text: I met up with my coworkers here while we were in town for a business trip - a group of four. Upon entering the restaurant, we passed over a clear glass floor with fish swimming around, which was pretty cool. The decor of the restaurant was really nicely put together and it was a darker lighting situation. The menu had a good variety of options, we chose a bunch of appetizers (which were all very well portioned), a few mains and four sushi options to share.  The service was a bit slow to start - it took quite awhile to get our cocktails and the restaurant didn't appear super busy. Once we had input our order, it didn't take long before the food started coming out - the apps all arrived at the same time, then the mains, and then the sushi.  I've got photos of a number of the items we ordered. The only option that I didn't care for too much was the spicy tofu -- but others in my group enjoyed it. It just wasn't fried well enough to my liking and came in two large pieces instead of cubed like I'd envisioned. The wine was half off for bottles, so for $20 you can get a whole bottle (which a couple of my coworkers decided to do), and they really enjoyed it. The best appetizers, in my opinion, were the spicy edamame (the exterior is very spicy but tasty!) and Brussels sprouts. The scallop pad Thai was quite nice and I liked the caterpillar roll best for sushi. All in all, it was a nice location and easy to Uber to. If I were to go again, I'd want to try something off the grill- there were a lot of different meat options for that.

RYEMywoTmSR0gDASUmhU3g.text: Had a reservation for a group of 6 at 6:00pm tonight (Friday). Food came out pretty quickly, except for one person's that didn't come at all, for over 20 min. The server wasn't checking on us frequently and we had to wave her down to ask if the 6th person could get his meal. She said yes (no apology). Still didn't come for 15 more minutes, and at that point we need to leave for a show. So he barely ate anything. Then she brings the checks, and we were sitting in the bar area which happy hour drink specials apply until 7:00pm. We look and none of the drinks we ordered had the happy hour prices applied, so now she has to go back and re-run it all. We are now running late for our show. Still no apology. It's one thing for the meal to not get made, not her fault, but you should check on it and at least apologize. Checks are her fault. Three stars only because the food is decent.

Ek72Dk5VD5_TmUjF2HJd9A.text: If you're for somewhere to go before a night at the Benedum- try Social House Seven. I haven't been there since this location was old Bossa Nova so I was pleasantly surprised.   My mom and I got there around 6pm and got seated right away. Our waitress was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. It's a very spacious restaurant, so it wasn't packed at all.   It's a tapas restaurant, so lots of small plates. We ordered the California roll to start. It was delicious- probably my favorite thing on the menu. Next, we ordered the lettuce wraps with chicken - unfortunately- I didn't like them all.   Next up, we ordered another California roll to try and the fried shrimp - it was delicious!  Overall, I'll definitely go back again to Social House Seven!

NCjdDMVVZLIhdLyaom8NrQ.text: This place is amazing! Went there for happy hour and they have some of the best appetizers I have had yet. Cheese kurds and chicken wings are a must. 58WrpN48yllUAfmGezlO8g.text: Great food and atmosphere too! A tip...if Party of 4, do NOT get a booth unless u want to be cramped with deep vein thrombosis!  Poor design there.

Tn0razaf7-6NXwx3qCHyBA.text: Social house is definitely a cool atmosphere, somewhere fun to hangout and have drinks with friends while in the downtown area on a Friday or Saturday night.   However, as far as the food, the sushi was disappointing. I came here with high expectations, but I've definitely had much better sushi elsewhere. We also ordered the shrimp skewers which was the best part of the meal by far. This is found under the Robata portion of the menu, offering multiple seafood, meat and vegetable options grilled on Japanese charcoal. There are other options on the menu including a long list of appetizers and some unique soups, salads and noodles/rice. I'd definitely be willing to come back and try this place again and order some different menu offerings, but the sushi was unfortunately subpar.

P753h0wcpeKtbUhMSEbWow.text: Tonight we visited for the first time and wow what a great looking space, but the food and service was mediocre.  We ordered seaweed salad, unagi, yellow tail, rainbow roll and ramen.  The seaweed salad was dry and bland, unagi was very soggy (that is a tell tale sign of unprofessional sushi), "king" yellowtail had no fat marbling and the color was off, 2 of the 8 pieces of the rainbow roll where missing fish on half of each piece plus the rice inside the roll was cold potentially indicating it was premade and refrigerated, and the ramen was a bowl of bland mushy noodles and the pork belly was grey in color.    So a big nope to the sushi and ramen.  I think this restaurant has some potential, but no way I am going back.  Shame on them for serving such underwhelming food.  I'm shocked yelp reviews are so high.  If you know great sushi do not go here, and if you are expecting tentative and competent wait staff do not go here.

DbfOO0s9fbqr6Q5ABDPF7w.text: Amazing Asian fusion food! The ambiance was incredible!!  Love the mix of Thai-Chinese-Japanese  The Brussels sprouts are to die for, sushi is on par with Nakama but not as good as Little Toyko(lebo), the ginger fried rice blows the saga type places out of the water!! Their signature cocktails are honestly amazing. Pair perfectly with each dish and are not too sweet or too strong. The service was on par. Young wait staff...mostly in their 20s so it had an upbeat feel. We also had the scallop and the pork skewers. The scallop had AMA I got flavor but a small serving only 3 slices...the pork skewers were great and the serving was plenty big! Very unique flavor served on cucumber slices w a great sauce. The spicy tuna roll did have a better flavor than other places but the tightness of the roll and the ratio of filling to rice was a tad off!!

1dJ9mxwhRN9sJ9J-VHh3dw.text: Really great food here but a tad overpriced for the sushi rolls. I had the bi bim bop and was pleased but it wasn't the best I've ever had. Big servings though. The bartender Shaffer is great at making a spicy margarita!

uEHtx0aK1sloBJxKW6AfuA.text: I wanted to like this place but I was not impressed. Large enough to share with 2-3 other people but nothing special. Fish tacos tasted very fishy. Pad Thai was not good and the two scallops were fried. Sushi burrito was fine and had a good kick. Decor was nice and the staff was friendly, but I don't plan on coming back.

eJsPrZasQ8YHa9J_pO72Yw.text: First of all Kizzy must be your waiter! He is amazing. That said, we were given two menus. One for Valentine's Day and one regular menu. twjreMXoPPdOnLr7ES-MYw.text: I have to admit there seemed to be someone in the kitchen who did not want me to enjoy my food. I still am giving a good review since I was there on Labor Day and they probably didn't have the regular crew in the kitchen. Let me start by saying the design of the place is very well done and something I would expect to see in Dubai. I sat at the bar since I was alone and enjoyed their cocktails menu. Interesting choices and well prepared. I had the ginger green salad and spicy tuna sushi to start. The salad was perfect, and I enjoyed the sushi until I ate one piece that a big wad of wasabi on it. It was dark so I didn't see it, but I definitely tasted it! At least it cleared my nostrils, but it was wired to find that on the sushi. I then ordered the ramen looking foreword to some nice pork belly. The noodles were so salty I couldn't eat the dish. I had to send it back, which is really rare for me. Like I said at the beginning of this review I think it was not the normal kitchen staff and I will definitely come back to try again!

YakFFP5A281m4Vp9T9S6ng.text: Usually hip restaurants don't have particularly good food, and Social House Seven tries painfully hard to be hip, with the fish tank in the floor when you walk in and the colorful projections all over the walls.   I almost didn't eat here because they didn't show any reservations available on Opentable, then I somehow got double booked when I called in and tried to make a reservation. This is one area where they could definitely improve.   Anyway, this is a fun restaurant and food is tasty, but nothing was particularly mind-blowing. Service was great. It's worth a try.

ks0bnWmSw6L_0MquFBMLog.text: I don't understand the appeal.  It's loud so it's tough to be social and the food is mediocre.  We had 4 dishes between us and there isn't one I'd want to order again.  It gets 2 stars instead of 1 because it does have nice atmosphere and the staff was decent.

-35TZAoyr7v0GlhokZjUIg.text: Inexperienced server.  Ordered regular vodka martini, came as dirty.  Appetizers were great, pad Thai entree as well.  Ordered 3 Robata grill entrees:  scallops weren't even seared, completely raw, monkfish great taste but was completely cold, sat too long before serving, wings good flavor but undercooked as well.  Manager removed all these items from bill. Just wasn't a very good experience.

b2txNrc8_BjR66n3PZfytQ.text: We did not have a reservation on a Friday night and had a cool booth with dim lighting.  Super praise to whomever chose the lighting.  From the pleasant servers; to the seating (plenty of seating areas that offer privacy or an ability to just focus on your companions and not hearing other's conversations); food (sushi, pad thai, chilean sea bass, desserts, lobster spring rolls;) to the cleanliness everywhere, this is a very good restaurant.  I am not accustomed to how they serve their pad thai but the next day it was way better.  Ordered mine with shrimp and the kitchen was very generous.   Their seafood entree's, sushi, drinks and appetizers were great.

cZVqa-slZjtRbSirbYNrFg.text: Great place in da Burgh! Took the whole family. Sushi, yellowtail collar, salmon udon, mmmmmmm. Stay away from the wings..... but a great place on a warm summer night. Love it!

oBjFcNGOQ8hPvce-Y9wl0g.text: Came here for lunch on a Friday. Upon walking in, I loved the atmosphere, the decor, everything about it.   However, for being dead that day, the service was definitely lacking. Our entrees came before our soup and salad, so I had to ask that my sushi be kept on ice while I ate my soup. The drinks were average, highly over-priced for the tiny size, and I requested orange bitters on my drink. The bartender put the bitters in the middle of the drink and my soda water on top, which defeats the whole purpose and they were completely lost in the drink. Big let down.  As for the food...the mushroom soup was very flavorful and very spicy. I enjoyed it, despite the spice level giving me a runny nose.  For dietary reasons I requested my godzilla roll without rice, and rather than just roll them up without it like every other place does, they put everything on a plate and I had to assemble my own. I ended up having sushi tacos. They were tasty, but it seems ridiculous that I couldn't enjoy a more traditional meal, sans rice.  My friend got the salad which looked nice  and he also got the poke aloha roll. It was beautiful and tasty but extremely heavy on the rice  which for me, is a bad sign and does not reflect well on the sushi chef.   All-in-all, I would say it is a nice atmosphere, but over-priced. I would also not go again at lunch because they only serve from their lunch menu and the sushi bar menu isn't available. It was a bit anticlimactic.

FG9jMn-X4E8ZGOvVX0GY8w.text: I am giving this place 3 stars for now, because I haven't eaten here and feel like that would be a large chunk of the review. I came here for a few drinks on a Friday night. It was pretty busy, but it didn't look like there was an insane wait for people wanting to eat. The drink selection was pretty decent, and the prices were pretty standard for a place downtown.  The decor is super trendy, but I can see where someone would think it might a little overwhelming. There is a coy pond when you walk in, so that was cool but also weird. There were two bars, which is a nice touch because they were both pretty busy by the time we left.The food smelled really good - I would definitely come back to try it.

Es9UIGA9CcoNHrr2mBTl8Q.text: We just ate here.  The drinks were excellent.  My wife's sushi was good.  I order the chicken soy meal.  Out came two tiny and I MEAN tiny skewers that after two bites they were gone.  $65.00 bucks and left hungry.  No rice or veggies with them.  Ugh feel ripped off.  Great atmosphere, nice waiter but the portions.....horrid.  They could be great but making stupid mistakes.   Go for the drinks but leave.  Don't eat here.

k5fawsEGvsCdQKDZyJF-bg.text: I have been to Social House twice but the first time I only had beer so I figured i'd wait for food to happen before I judged. I have a lot of positives and a few critiques about the dinner I had there last night. I went with 3 other girls. The staff was super friendly and our waitress was really helpful and nice! She told us that they specialize in small plates. So, to say that we ordered an insane amount of food would be an understatement. I believe we ordered about 5 apps and 3 entrees to share. All of the food was fantastic!! Some of the highlights would be the chee chee brussel sprouts and the scallop pad thai. The aloha poke roll was also a big hit with everyone. I really have zero complaints about any of the food or the staff.   Now onto a few issues. While our waitress was great, i wasn't expecting some of the portions of the food to be so large because of being told it was small plates. Not generally an issue, unless you have no ability to take leftovers home and have to waste delicious, precious food!  That criticism is minor and really, who cares if the food is good? The one issue I had with the meal  what the timing. Yes, i want my food out hot, fresh and fast. But, everything came out practically at once and it made the meal pretty hectic. With this crowd... the older we get, the more anxious we get and i was pretty shocked no one needed a paper bag. I'll definitely be returning to Social House and now I am equipped with the knowledge to make the meal worth 5 stars!

4sl3bYrhLBXbO0hBSZ0irg.text: I really enjoyed my meal here. I've been quite disappointed in a few of the new, overpriced, super trendy places that I've tried downtown, but I would definitely go here again. I really enjoyed the set-up of the bar and dining rooms.   Apps are served tapas style, so we stayed away from that menu as there were only two of us and we were both very hungry. The whole "tapas" thing in general seems like a hidden way to charge more for less if it is served in a pretty way, but maybe that's just me. That being said, just know what you are ordering so you're not disappointed. Apps menu would likely be good for a large group that likes to share.  We started with sharing a Spicy Crab salad and a caterpillar roll, both of which I enjoyed and were great to share. For our entrees, I got the Sea bass Pumpkin Noodle and my friend had the Scallop Pad Thai. I really enjoyed both of those too! I didn't read the menu close enough to realize that the noodles served with my dish were squash noodles, rather than regular noodles in a pumpkin sauce, but I was still happy with my decision. Sea bass is my absolute favorite fish and it was cooked very well, perfectly juicy and buttery. The scallops were also well-cooked and although I've never had them served with a peanut-style sauce, it was a great combination.  We decided to be ultimately indulgent and also go for dessert. We split the Fortune Cookie and we didn't leave a single crumb behind. A giant fortune cookie dipped in chocolate, topped with toasted coconut and filled with chocolate mousse. You really can't go wrong with that.

WtlZhslBlMv_KssFVAOgNw.text: To sum it up: Good, but pricey and loud.   Came by around 8 on a Friday night for a drink and some food. We weren't sure if we would have dinner here or just some snacks -- we ended up sharing two plates which was dinner for me and snacks for my fiance -- due to the disparity in our appetites. We each tried one of the Japanese beers on tap. Tasty, but probably what would be considered a coors light in Japan and overpriced for a light pilsner.   We shared the spicy tuna roll and the fried brussel sprouts. Both were really tasty and a good compliment to one another. I really enjoyed both dishes but I will always believe that $10 is steep for brussell sprouts.  Another thing to note is there is kind of a party atmosphere. We sat at a window seat facing the street but a guy at a table with a party of about 8 behind us was SCREAMING non-stop and really disruptive. I wouldn't head here for a quiet, romantic meal.   Overall I liked it, but when I want to really splurge going out I have to LOVE it. There are just too many options for good Asian food in town to justify spending $40 before tip on two beers and two appetizers.

KT03R4xZ23k3uk1JyigSWw.text: Stopped in for a drink before the baseball game. We had been walking around the city and there was really very little to do so why not drink!   We sat at the bar. It was maybe 1:30/2 pm. The bartender gave us our drinks and chatted us up. She was fantastic. She was mid 20's and adventurous. She made a mad drink and kept us there longer than we should have. Service on this day at this bar was perfection.   The food looked great. The menu was nice. The place was huge and clean but the one downer.... there was no-one here. We talked to the bartender about this. She mentioned that they are working on bringing Pittsburgh back and there was an explosion of local restaurants which the city can't really handle at this point. Too many restaurants and not enough people dining at them. Which is bad for business but good as to a person's choices.

lrjrdIlmbi1XiFJM6WyPFg.text: I visited this location on a Saturday night for a few adult beverages. It attracts a higher class and nice looking crowd. Drinks are priced as expected for a trendy upscale spot. I hear mixed reviews about the menu. I will defiantly visit again.

PhLQTcnlFjL5SHaFYfQGPg.text: I couldn't give it 5 stars because my Salmon was over cooked and not that great overall. Went for the first time today at lunch. Ordered the Edamame appetizer which was delicious! I ordered the coconut fried rice with seared salmon. The rice was tasty but a little plain. I would have like more red onion and bean sprouts. The salmon was completely cooked thru when I ordered it medium rare. My friend had the tempura broccoli salad with rock shrimp and she enjoyed it. The waitress was attentive and friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Price was food. I would go back again and try the sushi. Great decor and a nice addition to downtown

gnbAHa_KP5fVJ3BcvDsJsg.text: Love this place! I enjoyed their Japanese cuisine in a very chic atmosphere. However, the turn around time to receive our food was very long which is way I didn't give them all five stars. But if you're in no rush and have the time I would recommend trying out this spot...especially for drinks and appetizers. This was my third time here and I will definitely be returning.

qyds4K_NDD1vtiXakis45w.text: Another great restaurant by Amp'd Group based and located in Pittsburgh.   Good sushi. Sushi Bar. Nightlife. Large bar area. Dining.   Interesting and unique libations.    Hot spot for Nightlife, see and be seen. Also good spot for date night, group dinners, parties, and business social networking. Local neighborhood eatery and vibrant bar scene.

Ux3IrgkU0787c0n2vEqMvg.text: Very cool ambience and amazing food. Have been here three times and always have enjoyed myself. AJ was super helpful in giving good recommendations while taking care of us. Really nice waitresses and bus boys.

z3V25WE8NsObEQ3313O56A.text: Social House Seven had a nice decor/atmosphere, interesting food options, and ok service. My husband and I had an early dinner there last night before the baseball game.   We ordered four items to share: CHEE CHEE FRIED BRUSSEL SPROUTS, CRISPY ROCK SHRIMP, WOK CHARRED RICE CAKES, and MONKFISH SKEWERS. The brussels sprouts were delicious and the shrimp were pretty tasty. We did not like the rice cakes - they were such a weird, chewy texture. We tried to eat some as leftovers today and they had become really hard and inedible. The monkfish was just sort of bland. I also enjoyed a SAKE BOAT cocktail, which was great, though I wish I had known about their happy hour specials (I just now saw them on the website).  Our server was nice but seemed inexperienced. Another server came by and cleared one of our plates before I was finished with it, without asking, which was irritating.  I may try this place again, but it wouldn't be at the top of my list.

sibEsmP0kbMhyCBXtGkdIA.text: Great find downtown. Had grilled Wagyu beef with grilled asparagus -- both delightful. Beef cut in portions for chopstick use with good soy and aioli dipping sauce options. Others had rainbow sushi platter and bibimbap. Sushi melted in the mouth. Should have asked for the gochujang sauce on the side as it was a bit warm.   Wait staff were attentive and helpful when choosing the food. On our list to come back to when we are in town again.

iLfZPPCIEaQC34VkXu5caA.text: I would give them no stars if I could. Overpriced, mediocre food and they only reserve the STREET PARKING in front of the restaurant for affluent customers with luxury cars.

Ie5h0VD0g5nxEkg4pgRZYQ.text: We went here because everywhere else was booked up on a Saturday night. We first ordered the broccoli and the pork dumplings for appetizers. They were all right, not amazing but still good. For entrees, we ordered the Bibimbap and the scallop pad Thai. The Bibimbap came with rice that was still crunchy because it was so undercooked. The scallop pad Thai was underwhelming - way over cooked scallops, atop a noodle dish that vaguely resembled pad Thai and tasted completely bland. To serve that and charge $20 is crazy. Our server was nice and made up for it by comping the Bibimbap which was appreciated. I didn't go in expecting anything mind blowing but was disappointed in the quality for the price.

GQ68wr1neokzwN8hirJsdA.text: Loved the decor of the place. Very nice details on the hanging lanterns, woodwork booths, and coy fish under the floor in the entryway. The food wasn't that great to be honest. Also, the restaurant was about 2/3 empty and instead of being seated in a both with my date, we were seated in a concentrated area of a large group, which resulted in me being hit in the back by the servers constantly bringing the group new dishes. While the servers were apologetic, it was disruptive and detracted from my experience.   The pork belly appetizer was pure fat. The wonton was friend fat. Both of these appetizers made us sick from the grease overload and had little to no flavor other than fat.   The grilled salmon and rice was much better and $14 for 5oz of salmon wasn't a bad price, but a scoop of Panda Express white rice was a cop-out side dish. The salmon wasn't terrible but it was not flavorful and had fishy undertones.   The Thai Chicken Lettuce wraps were good. No complaints.   The sea bass and pumpkin noodles my date ordered were overpriced at $24 for mediocre fish that was very thin cut. The pumpkin noodles were disappointing as they were unevenly cooked. Some were soft, some were almost raw hard, and overall bland.   I would concur with most other reviews that the decor and atmosphere are impressive and the location was good. But for nearly $100 (with Tip), I could think of 20+ restaurants in walking distance I'd rather go to. This was a $30 meal at best.   NOTE: I lived in Asia three years and none of this was authentic. So glad I avoided the sushi!

4WHJewje9JvxYwnf_WVrJw.text: I really wanted to like this place, but if you appreciate Asian food then you will not like this place.   We ordered a to-go order of dumplings, bibimbap, spicy tuna roll, California roll, and rainbow roll.    All of the sushi was bad to the point that we physically spit it out.  The avocado in the California and rainbow roll was rotting, brown, and had an awful taste.  The spicy tuna roll was just sliced tuna with scallion in a roll with spicy mayo sauce on top, definitely not a spicy tuna roll by any means.  The rice on all of the rolls was hard and barely chewable.  The maki rolls were sloppily rolled and put together.   The dumplings had very little taste, they tasted like completely bland mush.  The bibimbap was the only thing we could finish and eat and even that was below par.  Being Korean I've had my fair share of bibimbap, and its kind of hard to mess up.  Firstly, they charge $16 for plus whatever tip and tax you pay, it is definitely not worth it for this dish.  The rice, once again, was under cooked.  There was barely enough spicy sauce and none of the toppings stood out in this dish.  The beef was overly chewy to the point where you had to spit it out.    I usually give restaurants a second chance because the first time could have been a fluke.  But the fact of the matter is every single dish we got was disgusting. (how do you have undercooked rice in an Asian establishment!!???)  I will not recommend this place to anyone.

nth9VdvlG2h6UsrfRZNsJw.text: Another AMPD Group location, another great spot. AMPD Group concepts always end up being very well executed.  Great atmosphere with a nice drink selection. The staff was friendly and the food was tasty.  The fortune cookie desert was amazing!  Great new addition to Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great new Asian fusion spot

Kg8Hwn3gHReAoqdtsT_FXg.text: Unfortunately I cannot do a food review because I was unable to eat at the restaurant.  If you have food allergies....Social House is not for you!!  The chef does not have a separate grill or wok to prepare shellfish dishes.....so the fish and shellfish cross-contaminate.  Additionally, all the sushi...even shell fish sushi has fish eggs on the outer layer.....in this day and age, I was shocked.  Went with a group...so I just had a cocktail.    I did appreciate there honesty....this could have been deadly!  Ambience was to die for.  There is a curbside bar that fully opens up in good weather!  Cute date night spot if you can eat all types of fish!!

zNnwixKvsY8fdgN1FBlrOw.text: We came here after a mid afternoon show at the Benedum.  First impressions are the place looks absolutely lovely.  Lots of details to the wide open space.  And wide open indeed with a garage door style window in the front behind the bar.  Now we only had drinks so I can only really comment on that experience.  There was one other patron at the bar when we sat down.  We were greeted quickly and given drink menus.  The drink, for us, beer prices were about standard for downtown.  Between $6-$8 for most.  Some were really high at $10.00.  We ordered quickly and asked for menus, but the bartender never brought them.  Vigilant I sent my other half to track down a menu so I could peruse it while we imbibed.   Though we didn't order anything I saw several things that I would be excited to try.  I am hoping we have a chance to come back soon and really get the overall experience.  But for now it's an A-okay place to enjoy an afternoon pint.

DZ1_uL_RzM2vwXG4G1DkBg.text: A Groupon brought me in for the first time but the food is what brought me back! Social House Seven has some great happy hour deals on food and drinks but they also have such good food that you should come even when it isn't happy hour. I've had the Chee Chee Fried Brussel Sprouts, Steamed Pork Dumplings, Ginger Fried Rice, Short Rib Yaki Noodles, Green Forest sushi and Fortune Cookie. Everything was fresh and quickly served. Honestly, the Fortune Cookie is one of my favorite desserts. It is a giant fortune cookie filled with dark chocolate and white chocolate mousse and it is heavenly. I love dessert but it must be shared amongst your party!

-p0uTMTPCmKj5vsJwI9jLA.text: The sushi was SO disappointing. No flavor at all. However their appetizers were pretty good. We got the fried brussels sprouts, pork belly skewers, tuna tar tar and the edemame. I also tried their seasonal punch which was really good but if their sushi is the main thing then THUMBS DOWN on that. We ordered the shrimp tempura, volcano, and the spider rolls. All of them lacked flavor without soy sauce. Maybe I'm spoiled by the sushi in Chicago but for how fancy this place looks I expected more.

qCX_A9MKgnlw0X76dCYAcg.text: Social House Seven is good, it's just not great.   The service is easily a 10/10. Others on here have mentioned the waiter, with the thick french accent, who is just fantastic.   The drinks are okay but there is a pretty limited selection of cocktails. Everything is overly sweet. The sushi is good but ranges from somewhat to VERY overpriced, the Pad Thai was good but only had two scallops (which were admittedly perfectly cooked.)  There is a bar which you can sit both indoors/outdoors which looks enjoyable.  All in all, not bad, just not great.

5GuaFIznmqtaH3erMbxR3g.text: I have been waiting for quite some time for this place to open after it has taken over the old location of Bossa Nova. And then when it finally arrived....I finally made it!!!! Social House is a very attractive environment with the fish tank floor upon entry. The waiter was very friendly and the best part, not annoying. Sometimes restaurants can go over board with the constant approaching the table. But he was very appropriate, but attentive and we enjoyed that. I had the Crispy Rock Shrimp and Salmon with Sushi Rice, it was very delicious but portions are quite small so be aware. It was enough for us, but not sure if It would be enough for others. For the drink, I enjoyed the Toji Mule. And endless sparkling water! My friend had the Sea Bass - and I did taste. It was very delicious. From a far at another table, I saw them serve from what it seems the Mongo Mongo Lamb Chops. I will try that next time.  It is a great place for a ladies night, date, or din din before a show. I look forward to coming back to try some of the other menu options.

photos.caption: Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Miso Glazed Salmon w/ Sushi Rice
Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sea Bass Pumpkin Noodle

KYoAqlB03Cs849ZgpUOfPw.text: First off - I am giving this two stars because j enjoyed two things - my drink and my sushi. I arrived before our reservation and had drinks and app at the bar. The Tojo mule is absolutely fantastic! And I enjoyed the dumplings and a pre dinner fare. I chose to have a farewell dinner for a friend of mine who is moving and I knew SH7 would be able to accommodate due to their lovely tables that transform for larger tables. After a few surprise guests, we ended up being a party of 10. For my meal, I ordered the spider and Godzilla rolls. Other guests ordered a mixture of things that we all tried. Chee chee Broccoli - bland. Pork Belly Skewers - too much fat than actual pork and yes I know I was tasting a pork style dish. Edamame and spicy edamame were both pretty good. My sushi rolls came out looking fantastic and tasted even better. We also accidentally received a ramen bowl - which I tasted - it tasted like the ingredients were not fresh.   What made me most disappointed about this was our cake. We brought a cake in and I called earlier and they said we can bring a cake but they charge a 3$ cutting fee. Perfectly fine. We get to the part of dinner where we wanted them to bring the cake out. They did and they plated the cake. A gentleman came over to make a big show of "cutting the cake". He plated the person of honors cake and then left. I thought that was strange but I assumed the cost was for purely cutting the cake.   What got me, was that there was a slightly larger table next to us celebrating a birthday and they brought a cake with candles out to sing happy birthday. Then I noticed a few minutes later that they came back from the kitchen with pieces of cake being served to the guest. Everyone in our party noticed that but we did not make a complaint since the bill had already been paid for.   The server we had was good. Prompt and itemized our checks without asking.   All in all, I find this place good for drinks and lunch time sushi. Come here for a large gathering if you want somewhere to accommodate a large party and your drink of habits but not necessarily your hunger.

CO8WwgsZrWEd8DNU4D9ulw.text: Their sushi pricing doesn't make much sense. They had one single piece of nigiri priced the same as two pieces of sashimi -- if you eat sushi, you know that two pieces of sashimi is twice the amount of fish than the single piece of nigiri... typically you'd see two of either style at the same price point. In this case, I was didn't feel it'd be worth spending $5+ on one single piece of salmon nigiri unless something was truly remarkable about it. I quite sincerely and politely asked a question about the pricing, and the waitress was super rude about it, saying "yeah I don't set the prices." Yes- I know that- I'm simply trying to source more information about the sushi quality... like, I dunno, was in flown in this morning from Japan or something that would justify what I am considering spending on nigiri? The fact that you can't or won't tell me why your nigiri is $5 for a single piece means this isn't the type of quality establishment that I'd buy $5 per piece nigiri from, so, your loss.  Anyway, that exchange just gave me an overall negative vibe. When my husband did decide to get some sashimi they neglected to bring any soy out, and I'd characterize my ramen as pretty shitty ramen. I'm easy to please with ramen, but the pork was like dry pork chop pieces in a super super salty broth that tasted more similar to Campbell's chicken noodle soup than to any ramen styles I've had in the past. The cocktails were overpriced, the dumplings were serviceable but nothing special. I'm a solid pass on this place for the future.

2y-vd8vV3Nos3Tp7OZIrTQ.text: Two people of four people at my table ordered sushi and got their meals in a reasonable amount of time. The other 2 people at my table ordered rice dishes and had to wait an additional 40 min before they were served. It took the server 20 min to even realize they did not receive their meals because she was not attending to the table. Mind you, we were the 5th table to sit for lunch.  It was clear that our order had not been sent to the kitchen in the 1st place or that the kitchen lost our ticket because of the 20 min it took to get our food after alerting the server that our order was incomplete.  Things happen at restaurants out of the servers control (I know this from years of my serving) but the least the server could have done was acknowledged and/or rectify the situation. Neither of which were done. In fact it took an additional 15 min to ask if the rice was ok after the long wait. No comped food or even an apology for the inconvenience.  Our 1 hour lunch hour turned into an hour and a half at the restaurant most of which was unpleasant.  Only rating 2 stars because I enjoyed my sushi but the rice was definitely NOT worth the wait!!

lplMmXyHoNj1VQM2ytFSig.text: Due to my usual sushi spot being closed for the day, I found this place on Yelp and I'm so glad I did! I came at a dead time around 3pm, so I was the only customer in the entire restaurant. My waitress was sweet and attentive and the guys at the sushi bar were pretty cool too. I enjoyed my service and my eel/philly rolls. Miso soup was tasty and they even had my favorite bubbly, Prosecco. The bathrooms are to die for omg. I will return for more lunches like this, but my next visit will probably be a date night. Thanks guys.

vl3NQJ5sZ1g3Ab-if-80gw.text: Our meal was tasty, good sized, and shareable for two. I recommend the Brussel sprouts and Latin roll. We were stuffed on apps and ended up not ordering a full dinner. Service was fast, waiter was knowledgeable and friendly. Pricy but, felt like the dining experience was worth it.

jX3ocJT0d6GvMThM5d2Jwg.text: Nice atmosphere, interested food and beverage choices, but, way overpriced for the quality in my opinion.

KH1AzV9MLB67XCU9KE0n4g.text: Second time is a charm, or that's the saying. Once again service seems to be an ongoing theme with this place. Me and friend went here for lunch will lunch is over at 2:30 so dinner. We were the only ones in the restaurant and the service was still horrible. However the food this time around was delicious. We had duck crepes and I'm not a fan of duck but the meat was so tender and had a really good smoke taste. We also had bacon wrapped quail eggs. Can't go wrong wrapping anything with bacon. And the price was really good. I had the godzilla sushi roll and my friend had the one with poprocks. The poprocks was interesting didn't add any extra flavor but popped in your mouth. It was interesting but one time is all you need. I wish they would work on having better service.

Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

sVsa7eSgYANPTlsDYOvNHg.text: Wow. I wish I had the pictures from the night we were here to add to this review.   PEEEYEEEEWWWWW  We went to try this place out as there would be Vegan options, it looked kind of upscale (so we dressed up) and was something new. I think it might have been a week night, summertime and the windows were open so a great space for people watching. The restaurant was nearly empty.   Walked in, 3 people standing at the door just stared blankly back at us and finally someone acknowledged us after about 2-3 minutes. They sat us by the window on a couple of stools.   No menus fro 5 minutes. No water, no one came to see us. Bear in mind the restaurant was EMPTY except for one party of about 6.   Finally, we had to get up and ask for a menu. 5 more minutes, still no one. We had to get up again and ask for a waiter.   When our waiter finally arrived (sorry to judge but this is a pricey restaurant) he was missing a lot of his teeth, the ones he did have were blackened and he smelled like smoke. I think he might have been from France...had a french-type accent. He was kind of aloof, took our drink orders and then 10 more minutes went by before we received drinks.   We placed our order for about 5 dishes...which he said would be "more than enough" for the two of us.   Let me make a long story short; LITERALLY 6 PIECES OF ASPARAGUS and 1 section of grapefruit for $12-15USD is NOT ok. This is not an organic restaurant...even then that would be robbery. It was slapped on a plate ( i do have this shot posted on my instagram) and just dumped in front of us with 0 care and attention.   3 shrivelled, dry, tasteless portobello mushroom caps stuck on bamboo skewers also do not command that same pricing.   This place is too big for it's britches and needs a reality check. If you're going to price your food to pay for your rent in an upscale location, you need to provide value for the cost. This place does not.   Two big, angry, ripped off thumbs down.

bk0Ao5ps1mm4Hg7WPgzVRg.text: Came here for dinner on a weeknight. Ordered the rock shrimp and Brussels sprouts appetizers. Both had little flavor but tasted soaked in grease... had 2 sushi rolls which were decent but we're more rice than anything... maybe some of the other food they serve is ok but I was fairly disappointed especially for a place that is pricier than the average sushi place.  The biggest problem was it seemed very dirty. Our menu had syrupy drink splattered all over it and you could see the table was barely cleaned off. For a fairly new restaurant it looked incredibly worn.  I definitely will not return.

0d5x2wjq6DMszEgSnFhOTA.text: Best part of the restaurant was the decor. Service was ok, had to ask for a couple of things twice. Medium rare hamburger came out like a hockey puck. They attempted to make right but the hope was gone.

pQW2f0zIuTHlshjhiOxKdw.text: My only hope in writing this review is to abate more patrons from the same bad experience my family endured. I was optimistic in regard to the food quality and never considered the service would be sub-par. Beyond that I never expected FRAUDULENT CHARGES!! We were a party of three and our bill came to $73.64. Social House 7 adds a mandatory 20% to your bill and encourages more with an extra line for gratuity, making it easy to miss what's already been added on, if you're not paying attention. Before this even happened, our food came out at room temperature. The rice felt hard and like it was sitting under a heat lamp. The waitress told us all portions were large and shareable. In reality, they are about half of what you would get if you were at any other restaurant. That is of course unless you were at high end place with real chefs. The food was truly awful. The staff clueless. The management unapologetic and aloof. So my vigilance towards the check was aimed at not tipping. I was truly appalled they added a tip at 20%. I disputed it and crossed it out on the bill. I rewrote the amount on the bill of just the cost of the food. Upon checking my credit card bill a few days later I discovered they added the gratuity back on. A call was made and management said it would be credited back. Please know they may no attempt to keep our business or even apologize for our terrible experience. The credit was never made and when we called back, "the manager" said this was now harassment and they weren't crediting anything. Not only did he refuse to give me the corporate number, but actually said we were reported to the corporate office. I have never met such arrogance of any business. It is palpable when you walk in the door, with no quality of anything to justify any level of arrogance. I am confident the poor business practices and horrible food will eventually meet this terrible restaurant's end. For now please BUYER BEWARE!

gCLZ3zP37q_t5_m1CGcWUw.text: Great food! We got the Brussels sprouts, poke aloha specialty roll, and robata salmon. All were excellent! The waiter was very friendly and made the experience good even better.

photos.caption: Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Social House Seven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Zw-UxblAlSe0JMotYghhuA.text: Location: 7th Street beside Howl @ the Moon. Street parking is tough. I recommend parking garages or lots when attendants are present.  Ambience: The koi under the floor entering were not around, hopefully due freezing temps. The doors and windows let a pretty whispy draft through the bar area. The samurai metallic black and bamboo floors and decorations are fitting, and the restaurant has a individual feel to it.  I would recommend reserving a red booth for a party of 3-5ppl. They overlook the seating but your legs are exposed to those sitting at tables below... kind of a strange set up. However, I did not have a chance to see it at capacity in full-swing.  Food: I was here for lunch and had the Korean Cheesesteak and Poke Aloha roll. They both were great recommendations from the bartender. The cheesesteak had a spicy bbq sauce that was on point.   Drink: Good scotch on deck: Macallan 12 and 18yr, Laphroaig 10yr. Double cross vodka which is hard to find in Pittsburgh. Also a diverse selection of Japanese whiskey... again, hard to find.  Overall: Good food for lunch and friendly staff. Service isn't polished and it's cold inside when it's cold outside. Good spot for sushi on a weekend when sushi no. 1 is closed.

1340isqpAfJgdnW7JYN6PQ.text: Came here for a date night before a show at the Benedum. I ordered sushi and asparagus and my husband ordered ramen and shishito peppers.   The ramen smelled weird and tasted weird. My husband was very disappointed and is now so turned off from ramen.   We were warned that the food would come out at different times because they have three different kitchens. I believe it was sushi, grill and regular kitchen.   My asparagus came out with the check. We had to ask for it and our waiter assured us it was coming. It was cold when it arrives and then our waiter just kind of ignored us for a while. Maybe out of embarrassment for the asparagus but we had to get to our show.  We mentioned our Benedum season tickets which should get us 15% off at Social House 7 and our waiter said we needed a coupon. Which is incorrect. There's no coupon.

oE5zGmxIZ38V5oGlnd0qWA.text: Pretty solid sushi & a nice atmosphere. Large space...decent Sake selection. Attentive service....as far as sushi goes in downtown Pittsburgh, I'd say this is an acceptable choice.

ed1ubC9CWii_KfkwpdA8Bw.text: I wanted to like this place but it was a huge let down. The atmoshpere was great and the drinks were fine but other than that I was disappointed. The food wasn't bad, it just wasn't good either. We got the shirt rib yaki noodles which were okay, the chicken with hidden dragon sauce (I think the only ingredient they used was salt), the corn robata which wasn't bad just very bland with no flavor and pork belly skewers which also had no taste unless you count the hair we found on it.  A waitress who wasn't ours also came around and spilled water all over the table and the short rib noodles. All of this for $84, which I wouldn't mind paying if it had been a good meal. Panda Express may have been a better option.

pOViiZuRd81N1GNK_HUTDg.text: Outstanding service.  Food and portion size were perfect. Atmosphere was great. Reminded me of Buddakhan in Philly.  A definite must go again!!

kAwu8gRC9gd6fmdAsJ6p0Q.text: Fun atmosphere for sure!!  First off our server could not have been more patient and he encouraged us to ask as many questions as needed.  He knew the answers as well.  There were four of us so we do sushi and shared a couple of "entrees".  The sushi was very good, thought flavors were nice and fresh.  The entrees were excellant except for the Ramen dish...rather bland.  The food was good...not the best...but the place is lively and unique for Pittsburgh.  I would return for the right event.

QlzGwK5kUPgZTLC1ldx2fg.text: Adjusted for price, this is probably my least favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh. I only had two appetizers, and they both were bad and expensive. The "new style sashimi" was $14 for 5 thin slices of cooked fish. No where on the menu does it say it's cooked, and nothing in the history of the universe suggests sashimi is cooked. To boot, the staff tried to charge me $28 for this ungodly abomination. That was quickly taken care of, but nothing else was done in a timely manner. I wouldn't even recommend this place for drinks as service was slow and inattentive at the bar.

rcV1fLrb6eFrCi_hPSNMZg.text: Eat here!  Have fun here!  Great crowd, amazing atmosphere.  A lot of care and planning was put into this place and it shows.

7x__e-hVCqriP9y8utis3w.text: My boyfriend and I ate here tonight. The decor and ambience is awesome. Our server, Lexi was super nice and explained how things worked very well. However, we were a little disappointed in the portion sizes of the food. Some things are over priced for what you get. We ordered the scallops first. Wow. It was hardly even half of one scallop that you got. The presentation was very pretty though. Based on that, we were just over it. Not sure if I'll give it another try.

IuAZ_JHIoDB0Ksd_nJsG4g.text: My boyfriend and I went this past Friday and loved it. Our waitress was very nice and helpful with the menu. I got the coconut mule and it was delicious. We LOVED the brussels sprout app (drooling just thinking about them). The sushi was good. There was a DJ who played great songs too but I could see why people say it's too loud. Cool environment/interior. A little pricey. Will return!

8ODBMo0ibLRAy3nEejKHHQ.text: First time here and I have to say, the sushi was fresh and had a lot of great choices.  I enjoyed my experience and will definitely be back!  Check it out if sushi is your thing!

silFRE2AJsrohwQVfmsLbQ.text: Very confusing menu. We thought we ordered miso soup but we got brought miso corn patties (as if that was a thing). We thought we ordered surf and turf as an entree and it was a double order of sushi.

lZ6ndF53X0lS5TpHX0Cv1Q.text: Over sauced, over cooked, over salted: But I'll start positively. Drinks and atmosphere are super fun. Everyone loves the fish tank floor and the art/decor is awesome. Ate here twice and sampled a ton of food off the menu. From the vegetarian sushi, to edamame, the broccoli appetizer and the soba noodle salad, I just wasn't that thrilled. Typically when I go for Japanese or sushi I'm thinking light, fresh and healthy. This is Asian food (all sorts) that's been heavily Americanized. Don't get me wrong, it tastes pretty good, but most things are deep fried or completely smothered in sauce. Nothing on the menu had that light, airy feel I am used to when I go for sushi. Even the vegetarian sushi roll came smothered in a white aioli type sauce that I don't believe is mentioned on the menu description. I recommend going to try out their unique cocktail menu and having dinner elsewhere unless you're prepared for something a bit heavier.

2EyhKmniEftg4QXLdkef_Q.text: Had a dinner for work here last night with people from all over the country. Everyone of them left saying this was some of the best sushi they've ever had. Great atmosphere as well.

7lI2AwcvuXg3BiA6UTLBCQ.text: Went to Social House Seven last night for a girls night out and had the BEST experience!  The food was amazing, drinks was great, the atmosphere is fun, decor is so cool... we felt like we were in an LA restaurant. This is definitely our new spot and I can't wait to go back next!

xvRXYPmIDvS8J7nEbirhIw.text: Food and drink are wonderful, however the two times I have been there, there were some problems with the service. The first time was on a Tuesday night where the waiter was rushing us although it was no where near closing time and half the tables in the restaurant were empty. The second time was on a Saturday night where we had a later reservation.We were seated on the bar side of the restaurant, which then turned into a club while we were still trying to eat dinner. I looked at the other side of the restaurant and there were plenty of open tables and the kitchen was still open. I understand needing to seat people in order to balance out the server's workload. However, after a certain time you should not sit people on the side that will then turn into a club atmosphere while they are still dining. I really enjoy the food but struggle with the idea of coming back and spending the money since we've receive below par service twice now.

FJ7GCb0leYGRJg-vPufXpg.text: We were super excited to try this place...and the excitement stopped pretty much right after we were seated.  The space is definitely impressive. We had one waitress come over to explain the  concept and take our drink order but because the music was so loud I only caught a couple things she said.  We ordered drinks and then 2 more waitresses came over to take our orders.  There was definitely some confusion, but that's excusable because it was opening weekend.  My $18 Manhattan was a little weak.  We ordered the duck crepes, pork belly, pork dumplings, kobe wonton, yellowtail and tuna sashimi, spider roll, and salmon sashimi appetiizer.  The only dish that I would even consider ordering again is the duck crepes.  Everything else lacked flavor, the sushi was subpar at best.  I've had better at small local places.  Our salmon sashimi never came so I can't comment on that.  However the mango on top of the yellowtail just ruined the fish for me and we ordered tuna sashimi too and I don't know what came out but it definitely wasn't tuna.  There is potential here, however the food, while creative needs to be refined.  If we want sushi, we'll go to Umami.
